description:
## Overview
[github.com/gravitational/teleport/lib/web](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport) is a Privileged access management tool.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Timing Attack via `apiserver.go`.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gravitational/teleport/lib/web` to version 2.7.8, 3.0.4, 3.1.3 or higher.
## References
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/commit/ee4eba392e58fe38def6eff75d98894fdfac3282)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/pull/2482)
- [Release Notes](https://github.com/gravitational/teleport/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#313)
title: Timing Attack

description:
## Overview
[github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3/s3crypto](http://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go) is an AWS SDK for the Go programming language.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm. A padding oracle vulnerability exists in the AWS S3 Crypto SDK for GoLang versions prior to V2. The SDK allows users to encrypt files with AES-CBC without computing a Message Authentication Code (MAC), which then allows an attacker who has write access to the targets S3 bucket and can observe whether or not an endpoint with access to the key can decrypt a file, they can reconstruct the plaintext with (on average) 128*length (plaintext) queries to the endpoint, by exploiting CBCs ability to manipulate the bytes of the next block and PKCS5 padding errors. It is recommended to update your SDK to V2 or later, and re-encrypt your files.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3/s3crypto` to version 1.34.2 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/pull/3403)
- [POC](https://github.com/sophieschmieg/exploits/tree/master/aws_s3_crypto_poc)
title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

description:
## Overview
[github.com/Terry-Mao/goim/api/comet/grpc](https://github.com/Terry-Mao/goim) is an im server writen in golang.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-Bounds Read. A message parser can be use to terminate the im service.
## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/Terry-Mao/goim/pull/327)
title: Out-of-Bounds Read

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. A large slice causes panic in decodeRecord method. The size of a record is stored in the length field of a WAL file and no additional validation is done on this data. Therefore, it is possible to forge an extremely large frame size that can unintentionally panic at the expense of any RAFT participant trying to decode the WAL.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/etcd-io/etcd/wal` to version 3.4.10 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/commit/4571e528f49625d3de3170f219a45c3b3d38c675)
title: Improper Input Validation

description:
## Overview

[github.com/uber/astro/astro/tvm](https://github.com/uber/astro) is a package tvm which stands for Terraform version manager. It will automatically download and manage multiple Terraform binaries.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction (Zip Slip).
Files within a zip file can break out of the target directory when being extracted.

## Details
It is exploited using a specially crafted zip archive, that holds path traversal filenames. When exploited, a filename in a malicious archive is concatenated to the target extraction directory, which results in the final path ending up outside of the target folder. For instance, a zip may hold a file with a ../../file.exe location and thus break out of the target folder. If an executable or a configuration file is overwritten with a file containing malicious code, the problem can turn into an arbitrary code execution issue quite easily.

The following is an example of a zip archive with one benign file and one malicious file. Extracting the malicous file will result in traversing out of the target folder, ending up in `/root/.ssh/` overwriting the `authorized_keys` file:

```

+2018-04-15 22:04:29 ..... 19 19 good.txt

+2018-04-15 22:04:42 ..... 20 20 ../../../../../../root/.ssh/authorized_keys

```

## Remediation

Upgrade `github.com/uber/astro/astro/tvm` to version 0.5.0 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/uber/astro/commit/2aec9b3a9a0422b66131f282f6eaccb6790f9445)

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/uber/astro/pull/47)

- [Vulnerable Code](https://github.com/uber/astro/blob/master/astro/tvm/utils.go#L69)
title: Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction (Zip Slip)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/tendermint/tendermint/types](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint) is a consensus package part of Tendermint.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). Block proposers are allowed to include signatures for the wrong block. This may happen naturally if you start a network, have it run for some time and restart it without changing chainID. A malicious block proposer (even with a minimal amount of stake) can use this vulnerability to completely halt the network. This issue is fixed in Tendermint 0.33.6 which checks all the signatures are for the block with 2/3+ majority before creating a commit.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/tendermint/tendermint/types` to version 0.33.6 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint/security/advisories/GHSA-6jqj-f58p-mrw3)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint/commit/480b995a31727593f58b361af979054d17d84340)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint/issues/4926)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/gophish/gophish/controllers](https://github.com/gophish/gophish) is a package middleware is responsible for the definition/​implementation of middleware functionality.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The Reset button on the Account Settings page allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a clickjacking attack.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/gophish/gophish/controllers` to version 0.11.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/commit/6df62e85fd60f0931d3c8bfdb13b436a961bc9b6)
- [Security Advisory](https://herolab.usd.de/security-advisories/usd-2020-0051/)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Output Neutralization for Logs. Secret leaks in kube-controller-manager when using vSphere Provider
## Remediation
Upgrade `k8s.io/legacy-cloud-providers/vsphere` to version 1.20.0-alpha.2 or higher.
## References
- [Announcement](https://groups.google.com/g/kubernetes-announce/c/ScdmyORnPDk)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/95236/commits/247f6dd09299bc7893c1e0affea11c0255025b96)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/95621)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/95236)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1886635)
title: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs

description:
## Overview
[github.com/square/go-jose](https://github.com/square/go-jose) is a Package that aims to provide an implementation of the Javascript Object Signing and Encryption set of standards.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Elliptic Curve Key Disclosure. It suffers from an invalid curve attack for the ECDH-ES algorithm. When deriving a shared key using ECDH-ES for an encrypted message, go-jose neglected to check that the received public key on a message is on the same curve as the static private key of the receiver, thus making it vulnerable to an invalid curve attack.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/square/go-jose` to version 1.0.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/square/go-jose/commit/c7581939a3656bb65e89d64da0a52364a33d2507)
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/164590)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/11/03/1)
title: Elliptic Curve Key Disclosure

description:
## Overview
[github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s](https://github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s) is a package that automates the deployment, provisioning, management, and orchestration of Elasticsearch, Kibana and APM Server on Kubernetes based on the operator pattern.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Cryptographic Issues. A weak random number generator is used for generating passwords. If an attacker is able to determine when the current Elastic Stack cluster was deployed they may be able to more easily brute force the Elasticsearch credentials generated by ECK.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/elastic/cloud-on-k8s` to version 1.1.0 or higher.
## References
- [Elastic Security Announcements](https://www.elastic.co/community/security/)
title: Cryptographic Issues
